changeMetadata.title: Database Migration to AWS RDS
changeMetadata.changeReason: Migrating legacy database to AWS RDS for improved performance, scalability, and reduced maintenance overhead. This change will enable better disaster recovery capabilities and reduce operational costs.
changeMetadata.implementationPlan:
1. Create RDS instance with Multi-AZ deployment
2. Set up database replication from legacy system
3. Perform data validation and testing
4. Update application connection strings
5. Switch traffic to new RDS instance
6. Monitor performance and validate functionality
changeMetadata.testPlan:
1. Validate data integrity using checksums
2. Run performance benchmarks
3. Test application functionality in staging environment
4. Verify backup and restore procedures
5. Test failover scenarios
6. Conduct user acceptance testing
changeMetadata.expectedCustomerImpact: Brief downtime of approximately 15 minutes during the final cutover. Users may experience slower response times during the initial 30 minutes as caches warm up. No data loss is expected.
changeMetadata.rollbackPlan:
1. Stop application traffic to RDS
2. Revert DNS/connection strings to legacy database
3. Restart application services
4. Validate legacy system functionality
5. Communicate rollback completion to stakeholders

emailNotification.subject: APPROVAL REQUIRED: Database Migration to AWS RDS - CHG0012345

meetingInvite.title: Change Review: Database Migration to AWS RDS
